newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Revlon ending production in Israel.
newsitem.headline: Revlon ending production in Israel.

text.p: Revlon Inc said on Tuesday it would close its Israeli factory as part of a worldwide effort to concentrate manufacturing in fewer sites but said it intended to retain its import and distribution operations in Israel.

The factory, located in Israel's port town of Ashdod, employs about 50 people producing toiletries and cosmetics, a spokesman said. He added that most of Revlon's Israeli sales were already from imported products.
"Revlon is not pulling its business out of Israel. We have been in Israel since 1961," Fleischer said. "Revlon has every intention of continuing to build its business in this country."
He said about 30 employees would lose their jobs.
